results.title: Reap the wild wind
results.creator_credit: Cecil B. DeMille and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Shipwreck on the Reef, Shipwreck on the Reef, this was the cry the local shipowners and salvage operators in Key West during the 1840’s awaited. Their business thrived on the cargo of wrecked ships but are all the wrecks caused by nature or man made? Why is it that King Cutler (Raymond Massey) always seemed to be the first on the scene? These and other questions are asked by local ship owner Loxi Claiborne (Paulette Goddard) and others. Meanwhile Loxi’s suitor Captain Jack Stuart (John Wayne) is suspected by the jealous lawyer Steve Tolliver (Ray Milland). Who will win in the romance stakes? The star studded cast includes Robert Preston, Susan Heywood, Charles Bickford, Walter Hampden and Janet Beecher. This Cecil B. DeMille production of piracy, hot-blooded love and huge clipper ships gliding in the mist won an Academy Award for its Special Effects and was based on a Saturday Evening Post story by Thelma Strabel.

results.title: Realms of the Russian bear
results.brief_description: From the Volga Delta to the mighty Russian Far East, from huge smoking volcanoes to cold icy coasts, take an incredible journey of exploration into the wildlife and countryside of one of the world’s most remarkable areas. Wildfowl and water birds, leopards and tigers, wild asses and Polar Bears - all are here amongst the amazing variety of creatures befitting this huge, little explored area. Presented by Russian naturalist Nikolai Drozdov, this spectacular award-winning BBC series is a visual feast for all nature lovers.

results.title: Feel absolutely confused and heartbroken about #Neighbours
results.material_description: digital screen recording of @mr_sjpatterson’s Twitter account
results.brief_description: Fans respond to the sad news that the soap Neighbours will be axed after nearly four decades. The UK’s Channel 5, the show’s biggest financial backer in recent years, has confirmed it will not renew the program. The hashtag #SaveNeighbours has been trending on social media since news broke.

results.title: Feeding and clothing China's millions
results.creator_credit: Andy Thomson, Dennis Sawyer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This exotic film provides a detailed picture of a very different culture, a cooperative and conserver society of the North China plain. Life here revolves around agriculture—wheat, rice and cotton crops—and almost everyone is involved in their intense cultivation. A cotton factory in an industrial city reveals another link in China’s massive, coordinated efforts to ensure its people adequate food, clothing, shelter and jobs.

results.title: Fear and Fantasy (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “All in the Mind Series”.
A psychological study of anxiety and prejudice. Highlights how anxiety is the root source of many prejudices and how group training procedures can provide personal insight into problems.

results.title: Gisser job (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “All in the Mind Series”.
Psychological studies of people at work. Considers ways in which stress associated with unemployment and among working people may be reduced.

results.title: Love Me Do (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “All in the Mind Series”.
Examines the social psychology of relationships, considers how stable social relationships are vital to human beings and shows how social abilities greatly influence an individual’s health and happiness.

results.title: Feed them to the cannibals!
results.creator_credit: Fiona Cunningham Reid, Baobab Productions and Dangerous to Know
results.brief_description: In 1972 a small number of lesbians and gay men held the first Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras in Sydney, a then militant solidarity march for gay rights. Over the last two decades the Sydney Gay Mardi Gras has become one of the biggest festivals around the world, attracting hundreds of thousands of international and domestic tourists every year. The film explores the history of the Sydney lesbian and gay community, a community organised around relationships of love, solidarity and pleasure and which is challenging the traditional ways society has understood family, love and commitment. Many of the activists interviewed discuss the changes in gay and lesbian politics over the last twenty years and the changes in the lived experiences of non-heterosexuality.

results.title: Fear eats the soul = Angst essen seele auf
results.creator_credit: Rainer Werner Fassbinder, Christian Hohoff and Tango Film
results.brief_description: Fear eats the soul is prolific German director Rainer Werner Fassbinder’s unsentimental interpretation of Douglas Sirk’s “All that heaven allows”. In this tough blend of social realism and Hollywood melodrama, Fassbinder examines racism and class in the love affair between an elderly German widow (Brigitte Mira) and a young Arab immigrant (played by Fassbinder’s lover at the time El Hedi ben Salem) which is met with hostility and derision from their family and friends. Considered the leading director of the ‘new German cinema’, Fassbinder had already dealt with this subject matter in his 1970 feature “The American soldier”. Winner of the International critics prize, Cannes Film Festival 1974. In German with English subtitles.
